docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Add to the list of tasks not done in Albany (''At Taxpayers' Expense,'' editorial, Aug. 22) the failure to pass Timothy's Law, a bill that would end health insurers' discrimination against the mentally ill.

headline.main: Albany's Disregard for New York's Mentally Ill

docs.abstract: William Estes letter on August 22 editorial scores New York State Legislature for failing to pass bill that would end health insurers' discrimination against mentally ill
docs.snippet: To the Editor:    Add to the list of tasks not done in Albany (''At Taxpayers' Expense,'' editorial, Aug. 22) the failure to pass Timothy's Law, a bill that would end health insurers' discrimination against the mentally ill.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Many of my middle- and working-class patients with private health insurance, or those retired on Medicare with no pharmacy benefits, pay hundreds of dollars a month out of pocket for drugs. In addition, they are burdened with high premiums and large deductibles on outpatient and hospital care.

headline.main: Who Should Pay Our Medical Bills?

docs.abstract: Dr Alan S Katz letter holds that any health care reform program should include federally mandated cap on drug costs and single-payer system for physician and hospital expenses
